definition: to harangue/loud arrogant talk/to spout
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
surname Tan
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
rich/wide/broad
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: So much for corporate rhetoric about adding value to commoditized products.
sentences.chinese: 如此多的公司都高談闊論着增加商品價值的花言巧語。

sentences.english: Don't be scared of high- flown language ofeconomists and Cabinet Ministers.
sentences.chinese: 不要被經濟學家和內閣大臣們的高談闊論所嚇倒。

sentences.english: The politician's speech was full of high-sounding words.
sentences.chinese: 這位政客的演說滿是高談闊論。

sentences.english: Andswheresis this loudmouthed corporate executive taking his holiday?
sentences.chinese: 然而這位高談闊論的公司總裁是在哪兒度假？

pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble

drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to persist in one's views
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
